Package it.polimi.ingsw.network.common.observer

Interface Observable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CountDownTimer
    public interface Observable
    This interface represents an observable object. It can be implemented to represent an object that the application wants to have observed.

    An Observable object can have one or more observers. An observer is object that implements interface Observer. After an observable instance changes, an application calling the Observable's notifyObservers(int, int) method causes all of its observers to be notified of the change by a call to their Observer.onEvent(int, int) method.

    The order in which notifications will be delivered may vary depending on the data structure in which Observers are stored and the notification algorithm implementation.

    Note that this notification mechanism has nothing to do with threads and is completely separate from the Object.wait() and Object.notify() mechanism of class Object.

    When an Observable object is newly created, its set of observers is empty. Two Observers are considered the same if and only if the equals() method returns true for them.

    See Also:
    Observer

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addObserver​(Observer observer)
      Adds an Observer to the set of observers for this object, provided that it is not the same as some observer already in the set.
      void notifyObservers​(int status, int value)
      Indicates that a change in the extender class happened and notifies all of its Observers.
      void removeObserver​(Observer observer)
      Removes an Observer from the set of observers of this object.

    • Method Detail

      • addObserver

        void addObserver​(Observer observer)
        Adds an Observer to the set of observers for this object, provided that it is not the same as some observer already in the set.
        Parameters:
        observer - the Observer to be added.

      • removeObserver

        void removeObserver​(Observer observer)
        Removes an Observer from the set of observers of this object.
        Parameters:
        observer - the Observer to be removed.

      • notifyObservers

        void notifyObservers​(int status,
                     int value)
        Indicates that a change in the extender class happened and notifies all of its Observers. As a result, each Observer has its Observer.onEvent(int, int) method called.
        Parameters:
        status - the status in which the Observable class is found when invoking the notify procedure.
        value - the value of the Observable status.
